Reason: The configuration option 'commitlog_sync_period_in_ms' in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact system performance. This configuration determines how frequently the commit log is synced to disk, affecting the durability and consistency of data. A lower value can improve write performance but increase the risk of data loss in case of a crash, while a higher value can improve durability but potentially decrease write performance. Therefore, any change in this configuration can lead to notable variations in system performance, making it performance-sensitive.
